snippet: Republicans and the coal industry were quick to criticize the move, which is meant to pre-empt states that refuse to submit plans of their own.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency will impose federal 'model rule' on states that do not submit plans for carbon emissions reduction under new climate change regulations; Republicans assail proposed rules and governors of some states that rely heavily on coal mining are suing EPA over regulations.
lead_paragraph: Republicans and the coal industry were quick to criticize the move, which is meant to pre-empt states that refuse to submit plans of their own.

headline.main: For States That Don’t File Carbon-Cutting Plans, E.P.A. Will Impose ‘Model Rule’
headline.print_headline: For States That Don’t File Carbon-Cutting Plans, E.P.A. Will Impose ‘Model Rule’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Coalition for Clean Coal Electricity
